pullRequest.title: #1108 transaction status now uses single byte for higher TPS
pullRequest.bodyText:
GitHub issue resolved: #1108 
Briefly describe the changes proposed in this PR:

use single bytes for transaction status for higher TPS

nodes.bodyText: I should add a try catch or maybe a default case that uses the old strings based approach.

nodes.bodyText: I don't quite understand what you're checking here. It looks as if it's testing that the new byte representations have no overlaps with "legacy" txn statuses. Why do we need to run that test as part of this code? Surely you can make sure of that once (the status enums are constants, after all)?
Can these be moved into the enum? And can they be made private?
Can we make this a private (final) field with a separate accessor method?
Do you want to put a further assertion here that after replaying the txn and getting everything in shape, the transaction file now uses the new format?

nodes.bodyText: Does that work now that you've made it private? I would have expected you need to use getOnDisk() here instead.
